str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To disturb, agitate, stir up, trouble. Of uncertain affinity; to stir or agitate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
